a.title: Slice path: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolvable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/fhirpat.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

a.title: Slice value: The value of the filter. If period is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within the bounds determined by the Period, inclusive of the period boundaries. If dateTime is specified, the filter will return only those data items that are equal to the specified dateTime. If a Duration is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within Duration before now.

span.title: Base StructureDefinition for dateTime Type: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.DataRequirement.dateFilter` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `DataRequirement.dateFilter` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `DataRequirement.dateFilter` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `DataRequirement.dateFilter` 0..* `Element`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `DataRequirement.dateFilter` 0..* `Element` * R4B: `DataRequirement.dateFilter` 0..* `Element` * R4: `DataRequirement.dateFilter` 0..* `Element`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `DataRequirement.dateFilter`, but has no comparisons.

short.value: What dates/date ranges are expected

definition.value: Date filters specify additional constraints on the data in terms of the applicable date range for specific elements. Each date filter specifies an additional constraint on the data, i.e. date filters are AND'ed, not OR'ed.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: A date-valued attribute to filter on

definition.value: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolvable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/fhirpat.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

comment.value: The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIR Subset](https://hl7.org/fhir/fhirpat.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

requirements.value: Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.path` is part of an existing definition because parent element `DataRequirement.dateFilter` requires a cross-version extension. Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.path` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.path`, but has no comparisons.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

short.value: A date-valued attribute to filter on

definition.value: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolvable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/fhirpat.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

comment.value: The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIR Subset](https://hl7.org/fhir/fhirpat.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: A date valued parameter to search on

definition.value: A date parameter that refers to a search parameter defined on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and which searches on elements of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

requirements.value: Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.searchParam` is part of an existing definition because parent element `DataRequirement.dateFilter` requires a cross-version extension. Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.searchParam` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.searchParam`, but has no comparisons.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

short.value: A date valued parameter to search on

definition.value: A date parameter that refers to a search parameter defined on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and which searches on elements of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: The value of the filter, as a Period, DateTime, or Duration value

definition.value: The value of the filter. If period is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within the bounds determined by the Period, inclusive of the period boundaries. If dateTime is specified, the filter will return only those data items that are equal to the specified dateTime. If a Duration is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within Duration before now.

requirements.value: Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.value[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `DataRequirement.dateFilter` requires a cross-version extension. Note that the target element context `DataRequirement.dateFilter.value[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `DataRequirement.dateFilter`. Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.value[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.value[x]`, but has no comparisons. Note that the target element context `DataRequirement.dateFilter.value[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `DataRequirement.dateFilter`.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: What dates/date ranges are expected

definition.value: Date filters specify additional constraints on the data in terms of the applicable date range for specific elements. Each date filter specifies an additional constraint on the data, i.e. date filters are AND'ed, not OR'ed.

short.value: A date-valued attribute to filter on

definition.value: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolvable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/fhirpat.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

comment.value: The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIR Subset](https://hl7.org/fhir/fhirpat.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

requirements.value: Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.path` is part of an existing definition because parent element `DataRequirement.dateFilter` requires a cross-version extension. Element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.path` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `DataRequirement.dateFilter.path`, but has no comparisons.
